official_title: A bill to amend the Lead-Based Paint Poisoning Prevention Act.

summary.text: Directs the Secretary of Health, Education, and Welfare to conduct research on multi- layered dried paint film containing lead compounds to determine the safe level of lead in residential paint products and report to Congress within eight months his findings and recommendations for legislation. Redefines 'lead-based paint' to mean any paint containing more than five-tenths of 1 per centum (formerly: more than 1 per centum) lead by weight in the total non-volatile content of liquid paints or in the dried film of paint already applied. States that this Act shall preempt state or local laws purporting to establish different standards relating to the lead content in paints. (Amends 42 U.S.C. 4821, 42 U.S.C. 4841(3))

titles.title: A bill to amend the Lead-Based Paint Poisoning Prevention Act.
